fields.headline: Irish group spends  £11m on sandwiches
fields.bodyText: The Irish group Greencore has bought British sandwich producer Oldfields for £11m, it said yesterday. The London firm supplies more than 25m sandwiches a year to coffee bars and has "significant capacity" to expand. Greencore also confirmed the sale of its pizza subsidiary, which went to a management firm for a "nominal consideration" after failing to deliver the expected results, and its food business Feldhues, which produces deli-style meat products and went to a Dutch private investment group for £6m. The group said the pizza sale would lead to a £24m hit in its results.
